title: Twelve ways Covid has changed life in the UK
description: From cancelled operations to benefit claim rises, how has the pandemic impacted peoples' lives?

title: Bosman at 25: Who has been the best free transfer?
description: From Zlatan Ibrahimovic to Jay-Jay Okocha - who has been the best free transfer in the 25 years of the Bosman ruling?

title: A68a iceberg: Science mission to investigate frozen giant
description: Scientists will send robotic vehicles under the colossal berg drifting in the South Atlantic.

title: The Papers: 'Mutant' Covid as London 'plunged' into tier 3
description: A new variant of the virus and the capital going into the top level of restrictions dominates the front pages.

title: New Covid strain: How worried should we be?
description: Scientists will keep a close eye on this variant to see if it is a better spreader than others.

title: Joe Biden says 'time to turn the page' after victory confirmed
description: Joe Biden condemns Donald Trump's attempts to challenge the election result as his win is formalised.

title: William Barr: US attorney general to leave post by Christmas
description: President Trump announces the departure of William Barr, who rejected his election fraud claims.

title: Gay 'conversion therapy': Man given electric shocks demands apology
description: A university is accused of giving traumatising electric shocks in the 1970s to "cure" homosexuality.

title: Covid: Millions more face tier 3 as new strain identified
description: London, most of Essex and parts of Hertfordshire will enter the toughest restrictions on Wednesday.

title: Actor Craig McLachlan cleared of indecent assault
description: The former Neighbours actor has consistently denied allegations raised by four women in Australia.

title: 'We'd just begun our careers - and then the pandemic hit'
description: The sudden lockdown in March turned the world of work upside down for millions, including the very newest, apprentices.

title: A palm oil alternative could help save rainforests
description: Plantations for palm oil are blamed for rainforest destruction, but an artificial palm oil is close.

title: Experiencing a lockdown world through hang gliding
description: Hang glider Wolfgang Siess lost his job due to coronavirus, so he started filming his flights to try and attract more people to the sport.

title: Cartoonist Charlie Mackesy: 'Don't give up, the storm ends'
description: Cartoonist Charlie Mackesy dedicated his drawings to the people on the front line tackling Covid-19.

title: Yemen: How Covid-19 spread in a war zone
description: Already facing a humanitarian crisis, Yemenis have been left in the dark over the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Covid-19 isolation 'detrimental for children' - Ofsted
description: Periods of repeated isolation have "chipped away" at pupils' progress pupil , says the head of Ofsted.

title: Senegal's Dakar Fashion Week: The catwalk in a baobab forest
description: Held outside because of the pandemic, a fashion show in Senegal embraces the environmental message.

title: Online harms law to let regulator block apps in UK
description: Ofcom would be able to fine tech giants huge sums if it believed they had failed to protect users.

title: Universal Credit: 'I felt guilty claiming benefits for the first time'
description: Women under the age of 30 have seen the sharpest increase in unemployment benefit claims since March.

title: MasterChef final is dream come true for Nepal’s Santosh Shah
description: Getting to the MasterChef final is like a dream for Santosh Shah, who is from a tiny village in Nepal.

title: Nottingham street dancer: ‘Why I dance in front of strangers’
description: Jamal Sterrett performs a style known as bruk up.

title: 'Unconscious bias training' to be scrapped by ministers
description: The government scraps anti-bias training for civil servants and wants it to end across public sector.
